intro: Pecteilis reflexa, commonly known as the slender false nettle, is a flowering plant native to the eastern United States. It is a member of the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its delicate, opposite leaves and small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. Its stems are often hairy and may have a slight scent when crushed. Pecteilis reflexa is not commonly cultivated but is occasionally found in wildflower gardens due to its ornamental value.
